column4: Can someone help me reinstall gcc 3 instead of 4...I think that's what's choking vmware
figures it would be that simple.
crap.
that didn't work
try export CC="gcc-3.4"
what does that do?
I my creaky memory serves, when a config script or make calls for a c compiler, it looks at CC first
what that's doing is setting an environment variable, you can see yours with env | sort
anywhere I can see a "log" for opening apps?
you can see a history of your terminal, type history ; I don't think that's what you're looking for, though
does pressing alt-tab show you the apps? (maybe a stupid question, but let's get it out of the way)
no it doesn't
ok. which apps? You have a very vague problem
two apps specifically that I installed..
vmware, I havent' a clue. Do you have java installed?
does java -version say something about 1.4.2 or 1.5?
well I reinsatalled v1.4.2 to get azareus working...
NOW when I go to install vmware again, it's giving me "What is the location of the directory of C header files that match your running
Like I said, I've no clue about vmware, except you gotta recompile your kernel or modules or some such. Never used it :)
strange because I had it working....
and if java is kicking back 1.4, maybe you need 1.5. I don't use java much, and azureus not at all.
your vague question came down to things I don't know :)
a shortcut for that might be just removing azureus's config in your home dir.
sudo aptitude install totem-xine ; that'll get you away from gstreamer
